title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 3 PIs, Overall very casual, they asked a lot about my past experience. I was asked to explain in details about my research projects, what model I used, any problems encountered. No technical questions were asked.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths that you can bring to the team.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI)
Interview Descriptions: I saw the listing online. It was all conducted on Zoom. They used a fair and detailed process with clear communication. The process was a lot longer than expected, having to interview with other departments.
Interview Questions: How could I imagine the department growing.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Challenging; multiday process featuring essays, CVs, and many group interviews. One had to be prepared to discuss case conceptualizations and research aptitude from several vantage points giving concrete examples in addition to case presentation and clinical vignettes.
Interview Questions: Discuss experiences working with multicultural differences.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and easy to talk to! The interview lasted exactly 30 minutes on Zoom, it was a pleasant conversation with a few questions. This was the first set of interviews for this role.
Interview Questions: What is your approach to working with/mentoring students?

title: Data Science Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: phone call and then code sample share. Failed at the code sample due to late response........... Tried to contact but no one responded, This is a terrible experience and don;t want to experience again
Interview Questions: failed at first phone call

title: Senior Associate Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: First round was about 30 minutes with hiring manager, 2nd round with search committee was about an hour, 3rd round full day on campus with short presentation with question and answer session with faculty, staff, and students.
Interview Questions: How can students best take advantage of the Open Curriculum?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was very chill, just questions about background and how my academic life has impacted my vision for the world. They looked at previous experience and went deep into that.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: confortable interview process. very polite and courteous healthcare members. Maintained professionalism and spoke with integrity and respect. Asked questions regarding my skills and ability to take on the roll. The interaction was pleasant and i felt confident every step of the way.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for this facility?

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: They had a really big shortage of staff for the position I applied for so it seemed as though I would get the job anyways and the interview was for precautionary measures.
Interview Questions: They asked how I would handle certain situations I could experience as an RA.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: They never followed up after interview despite promising they would be in touch in two weeks. The interview was 25 minutes long over zoom. The interview consisted of questions pertaining to higher education.
Interview Questions: describe a situation where you made a mistake

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Invited for an interview weekend, got to tour the city and campus. Interviews were conducted by walking to different offices on campus to speak with different professors (which were mentioned in my personal statement when applying to graduate school).
Interview Questions: Previous research experience, what I liked about Brown.

title: Media Producer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Easy, straightforward forward, and accessible. Three Rounds with assignments, background information, and why work at Brown University. Why are you interested in Brown and why would you be a great fit?
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Brown and why would you be a great fit?

title: Instructor(Summer) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: No interview, application process asks for cv, and a description of the course you'd like to offer. If your experience is sufficiently extensive and relevant and references are good, you will likely be hired to teach a one, two or three-week course.
Interview Questions: What course would you like to teach? Please describe in written detail.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to do a fairly extensive project for the second interview and block out four hours for the interview itself. After asking me to do this, they didn't even let me know I didn't get the job. Really poor experience.
Interview Questions: To create a learning session.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Brief, group interview, off site, typical questions you would expect in any basic screening an behavioral interview. Took maybe half an hour. Received a call a couple days later with an offer.  Accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Really kind employers with strong guidance and wholistic review process. Interviews were conducted remotely and were quick and well organized. It did not take long for employer to get back to me.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with undergraduate students?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of one phone screen interview and two virtual (Zoom) interviews. The whole process lasted about a month, they also did an education check and a standard background check.
Interview Questions: How do you handle competing priorities?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Standard process. Started with an initial phone screening with HR rep. Followed by a group interview in person with the team at the office location. The process was smooth and happened over a few weeks.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Why are you interested?
How would you go about identifying our target audience?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth, professors do not care as much about your credentials as long as you can complete the work. It gets a bit more competitive in competitive majors like computer science but for the humanities it is quite a simple process.
Interview Questions: How long will you be able to spend each week on this classwork?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal, they try to get to know you. It was conducted on Zoom. They are interested in knowing who you are and why you are interested in them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Brown?

title: Technology Consultant Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: First, an electronic application,  then a phone screen with human resources, then an in person interview with the hiring manager, then a group interview with colleagues both within the manager's group and across the university.
Interview Questions: Describe a task or project that you were responsible for that best demonstrates your ability to analyze information.

title: Special Collections Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: I initially received an email about a week after I submitted my application. It was a zoom interview, a panel of four people, about 30-45 minutes. Nine questions overall. Everyone was kind and I was able to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time that you worked as a part of a small group?

title: Grants Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were too many interviews with multiple people. If you do not make the 2 or 3rd cut, you never hear from interviewers again. They leave you hanging with no follow-up correspondence
Interview Questions: Mostly provide examples of how you solved problems, and work/deal with co workers and customers.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were informative but also not as intimidating of a process as expected. The entire course staff was friendly and actively engaged in the interview process, and the professor was there to guide the whole interview. They were great about answering questions regarding course logistics and transparent about the applicant review and hiring timeline. Overall great experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a teaching assistant for this course?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews - one with HR and another with the supervisor for the position. Relatively mundane first interview while the second asked some more technical questions required for the job
Interview Questions: Q: What is your greatest strength/weakness?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brown University in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with hiring head RA. The second round of interviews was with the PIs of specific projects to see where you might be best suited. All interviews took place via zoom. Everyone is very kind and super personable!
Interview Questions: What is your interest in working in this field?

title: Application Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Typical process. Apply online and someone reached out a few days later to setup a Zoom interview. Interview was fairly typical but was extremely disappointed to find radio silence afterward.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Brown?

title: Strategic Sourcing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brown University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: After initial email contact, I was scheduled for a Zoom interview that was very professional and positive. Brown University uses a standard interview format for first interview. I recommend applying to Brown University.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to report a non-compliant employee.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, asked about my experience with mentorship and how I set aside time for self-care and my past experience as a participant in the program. Overall was a very relaxed interview. Heard back from them within two weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you set aside time for self-care

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: good place to work on a day to day basis. Was a student there so no idea just writing this to get access into glassdoor so that I can check some information on companies I am looking to apply to for next summer internship opportunities
Interview Questions: tell us a bit more about yourself

title: Fitness Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Get to know you questions, what was a time when 
Why do you want to work for us? It was relaxed and over Zoom and took about 20 minutes. I interviewed with the manager who became my direct boss.
Interview Questions:
Get to know you questions, what was a stressful time that you've had at another job and how did you handle it? 
Why do you want to work for us?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was one introductory screening call and then an entire, full day of interviews with every person in the office. I understood the rationale of determining fit in the department but some of the lower level people in the office who would have been an equivalent or lower position were decently condescending and hostile.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a client who wants a project done by a department that's at capacity?

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Melbourne, FL) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview with an alumni in your area for a recommendation letter. If there is no alumni in your area you do not have to interview. However if you do it is mandatory and if you don't get a recommendation your chances are severely hurt.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to attend?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: PI contacted me for an interview where we discuss the overall study, data collection, participant group, etc. Spoke to one of the research assistants who told me details of daily work, expectations, how Brown was handling COVID, and what was rewarding about the work.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work background

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a three hour process in which the interviewer assessed interviewees in a course of group activities. First, interviewees sat in a room where previous residential assistants went over job responsibilities and then the group activities began.
Interview Questions: how would you handle a student who does not get along with their roommate?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: They were thorough and comprehensive. Interviews were over Zoom with a follow up in person. There was a direct interview with the immediate supervisor and then a follow up 4 person panel interview.
Interview Questions: There were many questions about directly relevant experience as you would expect.

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: It took about 2 months and then they provided an interview. After the interview, I did not receive a decision. I knew I wasn't hired because I saw the same position being posted again after 3 months.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5yrs.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about my background, including interests, technical skills, and future goals. I was also asked some science/technical questions related to the lab position I was applying for. It was a fairly laid back and friendly interview.
Interview Questions: What draws you to this research opportunity?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brown University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I found this job listing on the National Bureau of Economic Research website. The Professor emailed me a dataset to answer an assigned question. I emailed them back in a couple weeks with STATA results and a thorough explanation of my findings. I received a rejection over a month later.
Interview Questions: How much would quantity of gas demanded change if gas prices increased by 1%?

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: One brief phone call to schedule skype style interview, and then two skype session interviews. Asked basic supply chain questions and experience questions. It was a very long process, so definitely look other places in the meantime.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths? Greatest weaknesses? How do you you use the strengths to overcome the weaknesses?

title: Administrative Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Brown University in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very scattered, bias. Who know's who.  Privileged.  Interviewed with over 17 people for a management role.  Would not recommend Brown. They appear more liberal then they are. Did not see much diversity. Everyone looked the same doesn't represent student population.
Interview Questions: Why Brown why this role do you like brown

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then an in-person interview with the PI that took about one hour. All in all an easy process, though it seemed like they already had a candidate selected prior to my interview and were simply going through the motions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Facilities Management Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by in-person interview with Hiring Manager, followed by group interview with team, followed by two more group interviews. They ghosted me. I prepared and took time off work for the above interviews, and they ghosted me; this was several months ago.
Interview Questions: Companies ghost candidates at an alarming rate (while complaining they can't find talent) and it's time they were held accountable. I considered Brown to be "above" that kind of behavior, but apparently not. They have an online tool keeping track of all applications, so it would not be that hard to get a data dump of all the people with open applications more than a few months old, and then just close the loop with them.

title: Head of Shared Cataloging Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview with the search committee for 1 hour. I was then invited for a finalist interview which consisted of a full day interview with a 40 minute presentation and dinner the night before.
Interview Questions: Everything from the most general, high level questions like, "What was one of your proudest moments in your career?" to detailed questions about how I would handle specific processes and workflows.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed within a week after applying, and interviewed over the phone with the PI for 30-40 minutes. Interview was very pleasant, and felt more like a natural conversation than a formal interview.
Interview Questions: What traits do you look for in a supervisor?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Once I completed my online application, I was contacted for a phone interview. The purpose of the interview was to establish my personable skills and familiarity with their programs.
Interview Questions: Where have I previously worked

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done through Zoom and I interviewed with a panel of three people. The technology was a little confusing to figure out and caused a few hiccups during the interview. The interview lasted maybe 20 minutes and was not particularly difficult. All the questions were pretty standard.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the PI of the lab about a week after submitting my application, and the entire interview process took a little over a month with three rounds of interviews. I talked to the PI, a current research assistant, and another researcher on the grant.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past research experiences and why you want to continue in research

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview more elaborated on the duties of the job rather than evaluating the applicant. Only question that was asked was time availability. Students were brought in groups to tour the lab. The hiring manager hired individuals based on the application they submitted online.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Once I was recommended by a professor, it was a done deal. I did have to submit a Background Check, and some other paperwork. (Letter of recommendation, statement of intent, etc.) Nothing too hard.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have? Where would you like to intern? What would you like to do?

title: Associate Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied Online, a month later i was invited for doing a tech assignment( coding + data analysis).   then i moved to second round a phone interview, talked to a group has asked a bunch data science related questions, then i was invited to a onsite interview, spent a day with group and gave a presentation to data science and BI group.

People there are nice and chill, not a streeful position, and dont require too much techniques, the pay is low, however the benefits are extremely awesome
Interview Questions: doesnt ask something rare

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Skype with the lab scientists, research assistants and the program coordinators, talk about something from your resume and answer a few professional questions, you can also present a few slides if you have prepared, which might be helpful
Interview Questions: Why you choose this program at Brown

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: After reviewing the resume I submitted, I had an informal interview that was used to give me basic information and get my availability. At the end of the interview, I was given a tour of the building and was introduced to everyone that I would be working with in the future.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Ph D Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just standard interview, tell us about your research back in college, and why did you pick the school, why do you wanna work with Prof. XXX. Phone interview, no on-site interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you wanna work with Prof. XXX

title: Resident Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the website. I came in for an one-on-one interview that went well, they asked mainly behavioral questions. The regular process is a group interview and then an one-on-one interview with select candidates, but since the group interview was when I went abroad they accommodated me by allowing me to do an early one-on-one interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with someone and how you handled it

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable even though the questions were "out of the box" and unlike other interviews I have been on. The questions for the in-person interview were not necessarily about my experience, but you needed experience to answer the questions... so it was interesting. One thing that many other reviews prepared me for was to come with questions for the hiring manager. This hiring manager started the interview with "Do you have any questions for me?" Even though I was surprised at the change in format from a standard interview process, I was able to respond with well thought out questions that I prepared ahead of time!
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing for the rest of your career?

title: Summer Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI)
Interview Descriptions: Simple application that seemed like more qualifications were required than what I later discovered. Interview process was friendly and simple. I didn't receive any trick questions and it felt like my interviewer was doing her best to help me do well. It was a position that was mostly about sociability and responsibility, so there was no need to give an IQ test, and I appreciated that there was very little pressure.
Interview Questions: What was a major professional/academic struggle you faced and how did you solve the problem?

title: Research/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Easy, consisted of a five person panel, one day interview, interview took about 1 hour approx., easy directions and location, major negative: took about 1 month to fully be hired.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans?

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Set up a couple of dates and times for the phone interview. Three people were on the call besides myself. After the introductions they said while they believed I was qualified for the position they wanted to make sure I knew what the maximum salary available for their position was. After I was informed of that, and was told that it was a non-negotiable number, I thanked them for their interest and time and the interview was over.
Interview Questions: Salary requirements

title: Endocrinologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and friend environment . Everyone was clear on the question and they never lie about anything. From the arrival to the end someone was helping me
Interview Questions: How you will combine your passion for research and clinical?

title: Being A TA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the professor/ head of peer help in the department and explained my interest. Initially all contact was during the prior semester over email. We later met in person and she coordinated the details with the professor of the course. I was then offered the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was minimal. I had a developed relationship with a professor, and he gave me the job when I asked him for it when he needed a TA for the next semester.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in this position?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Brown University (East Providence, RI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fair. the interviewers were very nice and understanding. they asked questions but did not seem like an interview, more like a conversation. Brown is a very liberal school, it is interesting to learn about their admissions policies. With the new dean change, has seemed to prefer not many diverse candidates for an admissions counselor position. One undergraduate student from Brown of color and has worked with the admissions office was denied and took an admissions office position at columbia instead. New hires were White and had no qualifications.
Interview Questions: Thoughts on diversity

title: Artemis Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to teach a mock class for my interview. I ended up teaching a short class on how to implement binary search trees. Afterwards we talked about different situations that may occur during the camp and how I would handle them.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student wanted to go home from a location that was not what you listed on the field trip form

title: Teaching Assistant for Machine Learning Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took course and interacted with instructor, did very well in this course. Checked with instructor after this course and he agreed to give the TA position. I signed up for the TA and go to the TA hour and grade the homework.
Interview Questions: What grade did you get for machine learning

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: The process included two talks, one for teaching and one for research. By far the most difficult part of the process was an all department panel session (which was not very friendly).  I got the sense that some interdepartmental tensions were taken out on job candidates, which is not cool.
Interview Questions: 5-10 yr research plan.  I think its a bit much to ask, since such pathways are necessarily curving.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Through GRE scores, Toefl for non-US citizens, Under grad and Masters grades and letters of recommendation. There was no interview for me (in Physics). I would say having a publication in your undergrad or master will help.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: An interview is a conversation between two or more people where questions are asked by the interviewer to elicit facts or statements from the interviewee. Interviews are a standard part of journalism and media reporting, but are also employed in many other situations, including qualitative research.
Interview Questions: Academic BACKGROUND

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Was informal.  I had two phone conversations with my future research mentor, we decided it was a good match, and I came.  I was attracted to my department because it is extraordinary in research productivity, but it is also collaborative and supportive.  It's a great place to work.
Interview Questions: None.  The interview was very straightforward.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: There was an interview and many follow ups with administration. It took a few weeks due to having to coordinate with overall Brown HR. The interview was fair and I was asked about my resume and past experiences. I met with the people I would work with. We discussed the projects on which I would work.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult or unexpected question

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was an interview in the office with one of the directors. It was in person and one-on-one with the director of research. She was very kind and welcoming and asked many questions related to my resume and previous work experience. Additionally my education and relevant classes were also discussed. Many of the questions also related to leadership capabilities, times that I worked independently and research capability, as well as experience speaking with senior executives. Following the initial interview an offer of employment was made promptly.
Interview Questions: What was a time that you demonstrated leadership?

title: Master of Biostatistics Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Durham, NC) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: They do not really have interviews for undergraduate students who want to apply for master program. But, they give interviews to PHD students and ask typical questions like every graduate program does.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our program?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took place as a group interview, which was unusual for me, but fairly straightforward, as they were looking to hire multiple student workers for the position. We wrote down our answers to a series of questions before sharing with the group and with the employee who was hiring.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had difficulties with someone who was older than you. How did you react?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process is friendly and chill. Usually its just included a brief self-introduction and presentation of your research. Then the professor who interviews you will do the same thing about himself.
Interview Questions: Can you briefly introduce your previous research/ projects?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview so I'm not sure what to say here. You just go to the Ratty (Sharpe Refectory) and fill out an application. Then you're immediately hired and sign up for shifts.
Interview Questions: They did not ask me any questions

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: One of the most intensive interview processes I've experienced but over all positive.  First phase was a phone interview, followed by an on campus interview which required I develop a communications plan to be presented to the search committee.  The rest of the afternoon included three interview sessions with various panels.  Questions were straight forward and situational in nature.  Everyone was very nice, down to earth and obviously extremely passionate about their jobs.
Interview Questions: How can we get to know who you are as an individual?

title: PhD Graduate Student, Biology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with faculty in the department throughout the day for about 30 minutes each. Also had plenty of time to inreact with graduate students and post-docs in the department. Free lunch and dinner with other grad students in the program. Overall it was quite casual. Most conversation is aimed at getting to know you and your interests/ fit for the program rather than trying to trip you up or test your technical or intellectual skills.
Interview Questions: What other PhD programs did you apply to? What do you plan on doing after grad school? What type of research projects would you be interested in pursuing?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Skype interview with supervisor asked the PhD work and laid out expectations and how things work there. Described how long the contact will be. 
Skype interview with supervisor asked the PhD work and laid out expectations and how things work there. Described how long the contact will be.
Interview Questions: Describe your PhD thesis work

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions:
Have to be prepared. Interviewers are outgoing, friendly, open and ready to answer any questions about the jobs. But the competition is touch so preparation is a must.

Also, be ready to talk about research experience, whether you are applying from college or transfer form another school.

Be sure to show the liberal arts spirit. Be supportive and Be flexible.
Interview Questions: Technical

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: only submited CV, transcript, three references.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Career Center Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application was online, directly to the supervisor. Phone screen was set up quickly for 10 days later. Following the initial phone screen, received a reply to the thank you note but no further update (since I turned out to be a no). Did not hear definitively until I reached out for my 2nd post-thank you follow-up.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal manager... slight twist in this case because the interviewer would be the direct supervisor of the candidate, so you had to be very careful that your answer matched exactly what she was looking for. This required some quick thinking about any personal hints she had dropped during the conversation thusfar. (I didn't think the answer through thoroughly enough in realtime.)

title: Residential Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: First a one-on-one, then a full night of group tasks and interview process.  The process was fairly simple in the first round, where you get asked basic behavioral questions by current staff. The group process presents various scenarios and challenges to solve in a team of your competitors which you are evaluated by current Peer leaders as well as your potential boss . Very selective process!
Interview Questions:
Strength/weaknesses
Team challenges

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Brown University
Interview Descriptions: Emailed resume to chair. Got a phone interview. Asked about research and teaching assistant experience.
Interview Questions: What a specific research is about in terms of data collection

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: My department and others set up a matching system to pair students with faculty over the summer months. Everyone who requested a research opportunity was matched with one. It was done through our department's head of the graduate program, who talked to students about their interests and then spoke to potential faculty matches during the spring term to determine who would need graduate assistants and to facilitate good matches. It began with filling out a form and then a conversation with the head of graduate studies, followed by a chat with the potential match before finalizing the arrangement by email with the department office staff in the loop. Very simple and easy.
Interview Questions: Not much was unexpected or difficult, but we did have to choose how many weeks of the summer we were looking to be employed, and it was a question that depended on an educated guess about how much time we'd need for other summer projects. It was quite flexible in the end, though.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Candidates are invited for interview weekend.  Includes a full day of interviewing with professors and meeting current students in the grad program.  Usually followed by reception and dinner / drinks with current grad students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to Brown?

title: Residential Peer Leader, Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is well done. During the individual interview, a Community Director and a current RPL conduct the interview, alternating reading questions from a sheet with a numbered grading process. Then there is the group interview, in which they put 20 or so prospective RPLs in differing situations to see how they operate in communities and teams.
Interview Questions: Q: What does a safe and positive community look like to you? How would you go about enacting this community?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my school and was accepted for an internship. They asked me a few questions about my background and studies. My future career factored into working here, as I am looking to work in the Archival / Cultural Institution industry. There was a short trial period to establish if I was qualified for the position.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that would make you desirable for the position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with the PI, he asked about my background and he told me about his lab and the research that his lab conducts. He called my references right away, and I got offered the job the same day.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to get out of this job?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and in less than 48 hours I had received a phone call from a very friendly individual.  She explained the position to me and told me that the salary, due the position being a granted position, was less than I was currently making.  Being that I was relocating to the area, I agreed to proceed with the process.  We scheduled an interview for a Friday and agreed to do it over skype since I was still several states away.  She told me that they wanted to fill the position very quickly.  Friday arrived but Skype didn't work, so she and another woman called and we conducted the interview over the phone.  It went well and I received positive feedback. I was the first of several interviews. They said they'd let me know in a week if I made it to the second round.  Over a week passed, so I contacted them to see if a decision had been made.  I had made it to the second round and needed to schedule an immediate skype interview with the professor running the grant.  We had the skype interview which seemed rushed, after calling me 10 minutes late.  He acted like he had much better things to do and did most of the talking. I didn't get a good feeling from him.  They told me they'd make their final decision within the week.  Again, over a week later, I contacted them and they told me they went with another individual who had more "higher education experience"
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Give a powerpoint presentation of past work. Talk about research interests with hiring faculty. Talk about graduate degree work and skills acquired during phd. Discuss how to fit in current research.
Interview Questions: can you provide three reference letters?

title: Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: We scheduled a face to face interview after a successful phone interview - but the interviewers didn't show up! Even worse, nobody would return my calls or emails looking for a reason, or a reschedule. Unbelievable!  The phone interview went long, and was very pleasant. I spoke with two team members who were very nice, professional and eager to find the right fit for their team. We scheduled the live interview enthusiastically for the following week - to this day I have no idea what happened.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal workspace?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (New York, NY) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an old colleague, then received a call from HR. I had a telephone interview, then an in person interview with the director. It was fairly easy, and straight forward.
Interview Questions: Where I see myself in 5 years

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, some profs asked very pointed questions, met great continuing students. Some bits were boring, but generally what I expected. Very nice tour of campus. Not too technical, but assessed my thoughts well. Asked about what other schools I was applying to. Very forthcoming about what the school may or may not offer.
Interview Questions: How I would fit into the research portfolio at the school

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with an initial phone interview with two faculty members who then recommended me for an in-person interview. The in-person interview entailed meeting with faculty and staff members on an individual basis and as part of a group. Then I had to do a presentation in front of the entire department.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Information Systems Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: This was the longest interview process I had ever experienced.  I received a phone call a month after I had applied on-line.  The 1st interview was a 30 min screening with HR and CIS.  The questions were regarding my experience and background.  After 3 weeks, a 2nd interview was on-site from 9-2 meeting with 3 groups of 2 managers at each interview, an hour break, and 1 hr lunch with some of the interviewers.  Again, it was more experience questions- not hard.  The 3rd interview came about 3 weeks later.  I met 2 upper management at the same time.  This one was less than an hour- this one was more situational.  Mixed questions- experience and what if type of questions.  About 3-4 weeks later came in to meet hiring manager again (very casual- she was telling me the great things at Brown) as well as a new panel of 3.  Their questions were more situational.  Unfortunately, after 4 interviews meeting 11 people, I didn't get the job (runner up).  Everyone was very nice and it seems like a great place to work.  My advice - keep positive, be patient with their process, and keep looking in between their interviews.
Interview Questions: If hired, what would you do your 1st week here?

title: Undergraduate Teachign and Research Award Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Brown University (Providence, RI) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Application --- online then submit to reviewing comittee
Interview Questions: Why do you deserve an UTRA?
